data_availability: All raw eye tracking data (.tsv), preprocessed fixation data (.csv), and behavioral responses (.json) are available in the OSF repository (osf.io/demo123).
code_availability: Complete preprocessing pipeline, analysis scripts, and visualization code are available in the GitHub repository (github.com/demo/replet-kip-replication).
environment: See environment.yml for full computational environment specification. All analyses reproducible with conda env create -f environment.yml.
replication_instructions: 1) Download data from OSF, 2) Clone GitHub repo, 3) Run conda env create -f environment.yml, 4) Execute python run_full_analysis.py, 5) Results will be generated in /results folder.
original_study: Kip, N., et al. (2023). Eye movements in code review. Journal of Software Engineering Research, 45(3), 123-145.
power_analysis: Sample size determined via G*Power 3.1.9.7 for repeated measures ANOVA with effect size d=0.8, Î±=0.05, power=0.80
preregistration: Study protocol preregistered at AsPredicted.org (#demo456) before data collection.
